Q IRISH SITUATION COMMITTEE.Note by Mr, Long, I think the Cabinet should be aware that the irish situation Committee, which met to-day in the House ofCommons, were unanimous and most emphatic on two points(1) that the Government must) in the first instance, devote the whole of its energies to the suppression of crime in Ireland and that until order has been restored the chances of arriving at a compromise on the details of the Govern- ment of Ireland Bill are greatly jeopardised:(2) that, if it is necessary, the Government should be prepared to make large and considerable concessions with regard tothe Finance of the Bill. The feeling of the Committee on these two pointswas expressed with considerable force, and 1 think it important the Cabinet should be acquainted with it. (Initialled) 7/.H.L.5th August 1920,
